duties_responsibilities.duty: Facilitate and expedite outstanding service to clients, referral partners, community partners, etc.
Organize, maintain, & manage CC’s calendar, including scheduling of all appointments and meetings.
Handle administrative tasks & responsibilities.
Schedule travel and create itineraries.
Schedule and organize community activities & events.
Complete Intakes.
Open and organize client files.
Order, obtain, and organize medical bills and records from healthcare providers.
Prepare medical summaries.
Document notes in case management system.
Assist CC with deposition preparation, mediation preparation, and trial preparation.
Negotiate lien reductions with medical providers and health insurance companies.
Attend at-least two community events per month targeting potential clients or referral sources (i.e., GTLA Events).
Join Networking Group (i.e. Powercore, BNI, Chamber of Commerce).
Attend Chamber of Commerce Events.
Expand our medical provider network.
Meet with and develop referral relationships with other attorneys/firms.
Meet with and develop referral relationships with members of the community.
Manage Firm’s day to day administrative tasks.
Act as the point of contact between the attorney and clients, staff, and business partners.
Screen Managing Partner’s incoming messages, phone calls, voicemails, memos, and emails.
Follow CIL’s Core Values: Community, Communication, Preparation, Teamwork, Accountability, Execution, Results, Innovation.
Be on time.
Learn your responsibilities and know your responsibilities.
Learn what we do, why we do it, and how we do it.
Be an expert.
Take initiative.
Be a problem solver.
Think ahead.
Communicate effectively utilizing 7 C’s.
Be structured and organized.
Be positive and enthusiastic.
Pay attention to detail in everything you do.
Manage time effectively.
NEVER miss a deadline.
Exude confidence in everything you do.
Do what you say you are going to do.
Be a great teammate.
Give 100% effort in everything you do.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
